INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING MUSTER ROLL
Executive Officer.
Commanding Officer.
1. For additional instructions, see Articles D-4008 and D-4009, Bureau of Naval Personnel Manual, 1942.
2. NAVPERS 60ia, Quarterly Roll, must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers, attached to ship, station, aviation
squadron, or unit, for permanent or temporary duty, for assignment, for medical treatment, or for instruction-with or without records-at
expiration of quarter; also all reservists on active duty-with or without pay.
3. NAVPERS 605b, Report of Changes. This form shall be submitted by the following:
(a) Commanding officers of all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units, whenever a ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit
is commissioned or c
decommissioned.
(b) Commanding officers of all naval vessels when sailing from one port to another, showing all changes in crew since submission
of last report. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
Commanding officers of aviation units, ship-based, whenever unit ansumes a shore base status as a part of an organized
squadron, to show the transfer of men from parent vessel to squadron organization, and all other changes that may have occurred since
n squadrons when the units return to their parent vessels for the purpose of assuming ship
n from squadron organization to the units ship-based, and all other changes that may have
Equivalent to decommissioning the squadron.
(e) Commanding officers of all ships and stations on last day of each month, showing all changes for the month for which
submitted t
d that have not been previously reported on these forms. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have
occurred.
(R)
(f) Commanding officers of point or origin of transfer of enlisted passengers-men for transportation only-on date of sailing.
to show intended destination and name of transporting vessel.
Commanding officers of naval vessels carrying enlisted passengers-men for transportation only-on date of sailing headed
"Passengers" completed to show receipt and upon arriving at destination to show disposition. Any other changes that may have
occurred in the status of enlisted p
d passengers en route.
(h) Commanding officers of point of destination at the end of the month following termination of passage on other than naval
weasels, completed to show receipt of enlisted passengers from point of origin, name of transporting vessel, and further disposition.
If any be removed by competent authority from a draft on other than a naval vessel prior to arriving at original destination, such
competent authority will be held responsible for informing the Bureau on these forms of the vessel from which removed, of the
circumstances of removal, and further disposition.
4. NAVPERS 605c, Passenger List. This form to be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing passengers
other than enlisted personnel of the Navy taking passage on the vessel.
& NAVPERS 6064, Recapitulation Sheet. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau with the quarterly roll and with final NAVPERS
605b, when ship, station, aviation squadron or unit is placed out of commission or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent
to decommissioning.
6. These instructions are to be followed by all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units. Reports must include all enlisted men and
all reservists on active duty with or without pay.
7. After the roll has been properly made out and certified to by the executive officer, signed by the commanding officer, it must be secured
between the binder boards provided for that purpose, placed in the special envelopes, and forwarded to the Bureau.

4:
DETAILED INSTRUCTIONS FOR PREPARING MUSTER ROLL
8. How written.-All sheets comprising the rolls shall be typewritten, except those submitted by stations and vessels not allowed type-
writers. Black record ribbon shall be used and all entries on a roll made with the same type machine and new ribbon. When hand written,
black ink shall be used and all entries on a roll made by the same person in clear, legible hand. The rolls must be free from erasures and inter-
lineations. No blank lines should be left between entries, except in cases where more than one line is used in column 9 on NAVPERS 605b,
Monthly Report of Changes, when the corresponding lines at top of sheet shall be left blank; only authorized abbreviations shall be used in
filling out the rolls.
FORWARDING SHEET (NAVPERS 605)
9. The several blank spaces on the first or forwarding sheet of the muster roll are to be correctly filled in the following manner and
forwarded to the Bureau of Naval Personnel with each quarterly roll:
(1) The name of the vessel or station submitting the roll.
(2) Date covering entries in muster roll.
(3) Number of pages comprising the roll must always be stated in this space. If the roll contains 35 pages, the number "1 to 35" must
appear.
(4) Number of pages NAVPERS Cobb, Monthly Report of Changes, submitted during the quarter.
(5) Number of pages NAVPERS 606e, List of Passengers, which have been submitted during the quarter.
(6) NAVPERS 605d, Recapitulation Sheet.
This will enable the Bureau to know that all of the reports have been received for the quarter covered by the roll.
CERTIFICATE
10. The signature of the executive officer must always be attached to the certificate, and if this is omitted it will be necessary to return the
muster roll.
The commanding officer must approve the muster roll and affix his signature. The date of his approval does not have to agree with the
date covered by the roll.
In this space will be noted the date the roll was forwarded to the Bureau, and the location of the ship at time roll was forwarded.
It is not necessary to forward this sheet with NAVPERS 605b "Monthly Report of Changes" or with NAVPERS 605b and NAVPERS 605e
"Passenger Lists" submitted at date of sailing, but one must always accompany each quarterly roll.
QUARTERLY ROLL (NAVPERS 605a)
11. The additional sheets for the quarterly roll are arranged to be used on both sides and are divided into columns. Each column is headed
with its number and the information it should show.
Column 1-This column is provided for the name of the enlisted man and must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers,
on board the ship or station at date roll is submitted. It is to be arranged strictly alphabetically, without regard to rating or branch of service.
The surname is to be placed to the left and the first name always written in full, and the initials of middle names, if any.
Column 2-This column is provided for the service number, and under no circumstances will it be omitted.
Column 3-Rating at date of report.
Column 4-Date of enlistment. The date of enlistment as shown by this column must agree with the dates on the shipping article and
service record of the man, and it must always be the date of last enlistment.
Column 5-Date first received on board. It is intended that this column shall show the exact date each man on board was first received
in his present tour of duty. These dates will not be changed during a man's continuous service on the same ship or station. "Tour of duty"
and "Continuous service" mean the whole period from date first received to date permanently detached, and include (a) the time that may
be spent in hospitals or hospital ships for treatment or at service schools for instruction, temporary details in other vessels and at shore
stations, provided the men concerned return to the ships or stations from which sent on termination of hospitalization or training or temporary
details, (b) reenlistments on board, (c) when transferred for discharge and returned on reenlistment, (d) deserters from a command who may
surrender or be delivered thereto.
MONTHLY REPORT OF CHANGES (NAVPERS 605b)
12. The sheets are divided into two sections of 15 lines each. On the front of the sheet the lines are numbered from 1 to 15 and on the back
16 to 30, with the corresponding numbers on the lower half, so that the complete information on each change in status is visible without the
turning of the leaf.
Columns 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6-Same instructions are to be followed as for columns under the same headings on the quarterly roll, or completed
as indicated by headings.
Column 7-This column is intended to show all changes occurring as a result of men received (including temporary duty assignments),
transferred, enlisted, reenlisted, discharged, deserted, surrendered, or delivered, advanced in rating, reduced in rating, agreements to extend
enlistment, extended enlistments that become effective, retired, died, transferred to Fleet Reserve, turned over to civil authorities, also all
courts-martial and deck courts, all special or detached duty details including landing parties, or any other change that could possibly occur
in the status of an enlisted man. As many lines as there are changes should be used in preparing the roll. If a man is received one date, use
a line to report his receipt; if his rating is changed another date or the same date, use another line to report this change, etc.
Column 8-Date of occurrences in column 7. This column is provided to show the date that changes occur in the status of enlisted men
and must never be omitted.
Column 9-This column is intended to show all that is required by the heading, and in addition to the specific information required by the
heading, it is also to be used as a remark column and for any other purpose not herein mentioned that will enable the Bureau to know with
absolute accuracy the exact status of the enlisted man in question. As many lines as are necessary to show this information may be used. If
more than one line is used the corresponding lines at top of sheet must be left blank.
PASSENGER LISTS-LETTER FORM
13. Must be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing enlisted or enrolled men and other persons taking
passage on the vessel. Should passengers travel on other than a naval vessel, this report should be submitted by commandant of the naval
district from which vessel sails or the officer of the port.
RECAPITULATION SHEET (NAVPERS 5054)
14. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau at the end of each quarter with the quarterly roll, and with final NAVPERS 605b when ship,
station, aviation squadron, or unit is placed out of connaission, or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent to decommis
aloning, and is intended to furnish the Bureau with a rummary of all changes which have occurred in the enlisted personnel on board ships and
shore stations during the period of which the quarterly roll or final NAVPERS 605b is rendered. The number of changes shall be entered in
column to the right of sheet opposite the proper heading designated in the space to the left of sheet and must agree with the changes reported
on NAVPERS 605b; i. e., if 10 honorable discharges have been issued during the quarter, the number "10" shall be entered in the number
column on the line designated "Honorable discharges, etc." The summary is intended to show whether a discrepancy exists between the
muster roll and report of changes. The number brought forward plus total gains for the quarter, minus total losses, should equal the number
on the current muster roll.

INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING MUSTER ROLL
1. For additional instructions, see Articles D-4008 and D-4009, Bureau of Naval Personnel Manual, 1942.
2 NAVPERS 605a, Quarterly Roll, must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers, attached to ship, station, aviation
squadron, or unit, for permanent or temporary duty, for assignment, for medical treatment, or for instruction-with or without records-at
expiration of quarter; also all reservists on active duty-with or without pay.
3. NAVPERS 606b, Report of Changes. This form shall be submitted by the following:
(a) Commanding officers of all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units, whenever a ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit
la commissioned or decommissioned.
(b) Commanding officers of all naval vessels when sailing from one port to another, showing all changes in crew since submission
These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
quadron, to a w the transfer of men from parent vessel to squadron organization, and all other changes that may have occurred since
last report.
port. Equivalent to decommissioning the unit.
(d) Commanding officers of aviation squadrons when the units return to their parent vessels for the purpose of assuming ship-
based status, to show transfer of men from squadron organization to the units ship-based, and all other changes that may have
occurred since last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the squadron.
(e) Commanding officers of all ships and stations on last day of each month, showing all changes for the month for which
submitted that have not been previously reported on these forms. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have
occurred.
Commanding officers of point or origin of transfer of enlisted passengers-men for transportation only-on date of sailing,
to show intended destination and name of transporting vessel.
(g) Commanding officers of naval vessels carrying enlisted passengers-men for transportation only on date of sailing headed
"completed to show receipt and upon arriving at destination to show disposition. Any other changes that may have
occurred in the status of enlisted passengers en route.
(h) Commanding officers of point of destination at the end of the month following termination of passage on other than naval
vessels, completed to show receipt of enlisted passengers from point of origin, name of transporting vessel, and further disposition.
If any be removed by competent authority from a draft on other than a naval vessel prior to arriving at original destination, such
competent authority will be held responsible for informing the Bureau on these forms of the vessel from which removed, of the
circumstances of removal, and further disposition.
4. NAVPERS 605c, Passenger List. This form to be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing passengers
other than enlisted personnel of the Navy taking passage on the vessel.
&NAVPERS 6064, Recapitulation Sheet. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau with the quarterly roll and with final NAVPERS
605b, when ship, station, aviation squadron or unit is placed out of commission or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent
to decommissioning.
6. These instructions are to be followed by all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units. Reports must include all enlisted men and
all reservists on active duty with or without pay.
7. After the roll has been properly made out and certified to by the executive officer, signed by the commanding officer, it must be secured
between the binder boards provided for that purpose, placed in the special envelopes, and forwarded to the Bureau.
32:
DETAILED INSTRUCTIONS FOR PREPARING MUSTER ROLL
8. How written All sheets comprising the rolls shall be typewritten, except those submitted by stations and vessels not allowed type-
writers. Black record ribbon shall be used and all entries on a roll made with the same type machine and new ribbon. When hand written,
black ink shall be used and all entries on a roll made by the same person in clear, legible hand. The rolls must be free from erasures and inter-
lineations. No blank lines should be left between entries, except in cases where more than one line is used in column 9 on NAVPERS 605b,
Monthly Report of Changes, when the corresponding lines at top of sheet shall be left blank; only authorized abbreviations shall be used in
filling out the rolls,
FORWARDING SHEET (NAVPERS 605)
9. The several blank spaces on the first or forwarding sheet of the muster roll are to be correctly filled in the following manner and
forwarded to the Bureau of Naval Personnel with each quarterly roll:
(1) The name of the vessel or station submitting the roll.
(2) Date covering entries in muster roll.
(3) Number of pages comprising the roll must always be stated in this space. If the roll contains 35 pages, the number "1 to 35" must
appear.
(4) Number of pages NAVPERS 60Gb, Monthly Report of Changes, submitted during the quarter.
(5) Number of pages NAVPERS 605e, List of Passengers, which have been submitted during the quarter.
(6) NAVPERS 606d, Recapitulation Sheet.
This w
is will enable the Bureau to know that all of the reports have been received for the quarter covered by the roll.
CERTIFICATE
10. The signature of the executive officer must always be attached to the certificate, and if this is omitted it will be necessary to return the
muster roll.
The commanding officer must approve the muster roll and affix his signature. The date of his approval does not have to agree with the
date covered by the roll.
In this space will be noted the date the roll was forwarded to the Bureau, and the location of the ship at time roll was forwarded.
It is not necessary to forward this sheet with NAVPERS 6056 "Monthly Report of Changes" or with NAVPERS 606b and NAVPERS 606c
"Passenger Lists" submitted at date of sailing, but one must always accompany each quarterly roll.
QUARTERLY ROLL (NAVPERS 605a)
11. The additional sheets for the quarterly roll are arranged to be used on both sides and are divided into columns. Each column is headed
with its number and the information it should show.
Column 1-This column is provided for the name of the enlisted man and must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers,
on board the ship or station at date roll is submitted. It is to be arranged strictly alphabetically, without regard to rating or branch of service.
The surname is to be placed to the left and the first name always written in full, and the initials of middle names, if any.
Column 2-This column is provided for the service number, and under no circumstances will it be omitted.
Column 3-Rating at date of report.
Column 4-Date of enlistment. The date of enlistment as shown by this column must agree with the dates on the shipping article and
service record of the man, and it must always be the date of last enlistment.
Column 5-Date first received on board. It is intended that this column shall show the exact date each man on board was first received
in his present tour of duty. These dates will not be changed during a man's continuous service on the same ship or station. "Tour of duty"
and "Continuous service" mean the whole period from date first received to date permanently detached, and include (a) the time that may
be spent in hospitals or hospital ships for treatment or at service schools for instruction, temporary details in other vessels and at shore
stations, provided the men concerned return to the ships or stations from which sent on termination of hospitalization or training or temporary
details, (b) reenlistments on board, (e) when transferred for discharge and returned on reenlistment, (d) deserters from a command who may
surrender or be delivered thereto.
MONTHLY REPORT OF CHANGES (NAVPERS 605b)
12. The sheets are divided into two sections of 15 lines each. On the front of the sheet the lines are numbered from 1 to 15 and on the back
16 to 30, with the corresponding numbers on the lower half, so that the complete information on each change in status is visible without the
turning of the leaf.
Columne 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6-Same Instructions are to be followed as for colutans under the same headings on the quarterly roll, or completed
as indicated by headings.
Column 7-This column is intended to show all changes occurring as a result of men received (including temporary duty assignments),
transferred, enlisted, reenlisted, discharged, deserted, surrendered, or delivered, advanced in rating, reduced in rating, agreements to extend
enlistment, extended enlistments that become effective, retired, died, transferred to Fleet Reserve, turned over to civil authorities, also all
courts-martial and deck courts, all special or detached duty details including landing parties, or any other change that could possibly occur
in the status of an enlisted man. As many lines as there are changes should be used in preparing the roll. "If a man is received one date, use
a line to report his receipt; if his rating is changed another date or the same date, use another line to report this change, etc.
Column 8-Date of occurrences in column 7. This column is provided to show the date that changes occur in the status of enlisted men
and must never be omitted.
Column 9--This column is intended to show all that is required by the heading, and in addition to the specific information required by the
heading, it is also to be used as a remark column and for any other purpose not herein mentioned that will enable the Bureau to know with
absolute accuracy the exact status of the enlisted man in question. As many lines as are necessary to show this information may be used. If
more than one line is used the corresponding lines at top of sheet must be left blank.
PASSENGER LISTS-LETTER FORM
13. Must be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing enlisted or enrolled men and other persons taking
passage on the vessel. Should passengers travel on other than a naval vessel, this report should be submitted by commandant of the naval
district from which vessel sails or the officer of the port.
RECAPITULATION SHEET (NAVPERS 6054)
14. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau at the end of each quarter with the quarterly roll, and with final NAVPERS 606b when ship,
station, aviation squadron, or unit is placed out of commission, or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent to decommis-
sioning, and is intended to furnish the Bureau with a summary of all changes which have occurred in the enlisted personnel on board ships and
shore stations during the period of which the quarterly roll or final NAVPERS 605b is rendered. The number of changes shall be entered in
column to the right of sheet opposite the proper heading designated in the space to the left of sheet and must agree with the changes reported
on NAVPERS 605b; i. e., if 10 honorable discharges have been issued during the quarter, the number "10" shall be entered in the number
column on the line designated "Honorable discharges, etc." The summary is intended to show whether a discrepancy exists between the
muster roll and report of changes. The number brought forward plus total gains for the quarter, minus total losses, should equal the number
on the current muster roll.

INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING MUSTER ROLL
BNP 606a, Quarterly Roll, must show the name of every enlisted man attached to ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit at expiration of
quarter; also all reservists on active duty-with or without pay.
BNP 606b, Report of Changes. This form shall be submitted by the following:
Commanding officers of all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units, whenever a ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit is
commissioned or decommissioned.
Commanding officers of all naval vessels when sailing from one port to another, showing all changes in crew since submission
of last report. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
Commanding officers of aviation units, ship-based, whenever unit assumes a shore base status as a part of an organized aquad-
ron, to show the transfer of men from parent vessel to squadron organization, and all other changes that may have occurred since
last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the unit.
Commanding officers of aviation squadrons when the units return to their parent vessels for the purpose of assuming ship-based
status, to show transfer of men from squadron organization to the units ship-based, and all other changes that may have occurred
since last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the squadron.
Commanding officers of all ships and stations on last day of each month, showing all changes for the month for which submitted
that have not been previously reported on these forms. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
Commanding officers of point or origin of transfer of enlisted passengers-men for transportation only-on date of sailing, to
show intended destination and name of transporting vessel.
Commanding officers of naval vessels carrying enlisted passengers-men for transportation only-on date of sailing headed
"Passengers" completed to show receipt and upon arriving at destination to show disposition. Any other changes that may have
occurred in the status of enlisted passengers en route.
Commanding officers of point of destination at the end of the month following termination of passage on other than naval
vessels, completed to show receipt of enlisted passengers from point of origin, name of transporting vessel, and further disposition.
If any be removed by competent authority from a draft on other than a naval vessel prior to arriving at original destination, such
competent authority will be held responsible for informing the Bureau on these forms of the vessel from which removed, of the
circumstances of removal, and further disposition.
BNP 605e, Passenger List. This form to be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing passengers other
than enlisted personnel of the Navy taking passage on the vessel.
ENP 605d, Recapitulation Sheet. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau with the quarterly roli and with final BNP 605b, when
ship, station, aviation squadron or unit is placed out of commission or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent to
decommissioning.
These instructions are to be followed by all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units. Reports must include all enlisted men and
all reservists on active duty with or without pay.
After the roll has been properly made out and certified to by the executive officer, signed by the commanding officer, it must be secured
between the binder boards provided for that purpose, placed in the special envelopes, and forwarded to the Bureau.
43:
DETAILED INSTRUCTIONS FOR PREPARING MUSTER ROLL
How written.-All sheets comprising the rolls shall be typewritten, except those submitted by stations and vessels not allowed typewriters.
Black record ribbon shall be used and all entries on a roll made with the same type machine and new ribbon. When hand written, black ink
shall be used and all entries on a roll made by the same person in clear, legible hand. The rolls must be free from erasures and interlineations.
No blank lines should be left between entries, except in cases where more than one line is used in column 9 on BNP 605b, Monthly Report of
Changes, when the corresponding lines at top of sheet shall be left blank; only authorized abbreviations shall be used in filling out the rolls.
FORWARDING SHEET
The several blank spaces on the first or forwarding sheet of the muster roll are to be correctly filled in the following manner and forwarded
to the Bureau of Naval Personnel with each quarterly roll:
(1) The name of the vessel or station submitting the roll.
(2) Date covering entries in muster roll.
(3) Number of pages comprising the roll must always be stated in this space. If the roll contains 35 pages, the number "1 to 35" must
appear.
(4) Number of pages BNP 605b, Monthly Report of Changes, submitted during the quarter.
(5) Number of pages BNP 605c, List of Passengers, which have been submitted during the quarter.
(6) BNP 605d, Recapitulation Sheet.
This will enable the Bureau to know that all of the reports have been received for the quarter covered by the roll.
CERTIFICATE
The signature of the executive officer must always be attached to the certificate, and if this is omitted it will be necessary to return the
muster roll.
The commanding officer must approve the muster roll and affix his signature. The date of his approval does not have to agree with the
date covered by the roll.
In this space will be noted the date the roll was forwarded to the Bureau, and the location of the ship at time roll was forwarded.
It is not necessary to forward this sheet with "Monthly Report of Changes" or with "Passenger List" submitted at date of sailing, but one
must always accompany each quarterly roll.
QUARTERLY ROLL
The additional sheets for the quarterly roll are arranged to be used on both sides and are divided into columns. Each column is headed
with its number and the information it should show.
Column 1.-This column is provided for the name of the enlisted man and must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers,
on board the ship or station at date roll is submitted. It is to be arranged strictly alphabetically, without regard to rating or branch of service.
The surmame is to be placed to the left and the first name always written in full, and the initials of middle names, if any.
Column 2-This column is provided for the service number, and under no circumstances will it be omitted.
Column 3-Rating at date of report.
Column 4-Date of enlistment. The date of enlistment as shown by this column must agree with the dates on the shipping article and
service record of the man, and it must always be the date of last enlistment.
Columin 5-Date first received on board. It is intended that this column shall show the exact date each man on board was first received
in his present tour of duty. These dates will not be changed during a man's continuous service on the same ship or station. "Tour of duty"
and "Continuous service" mean the whole period from date first received to date permanently detached, and include (a) the time that may
be spent in hospitals or hospital ships for treatment or at service schools for instruction, temporary details in other vessels and at shore
stations, provided the men concerned re.urn to the ships or stations from which sent on termination of hospitalization or training or temporary
details, (b) reenlistments on board, (e, when transferred for discharge and returned on reenlistment, (d) deserters from a command who may
surrender or be delivered thereto.
MONTHLY REPORT OF CHANGES
The sheets are divided into two sections of 15 lines each. On the front of the sheet the lines are numbered from 1 to 15 and on the back
16 to 30, with the corresponding numbers on the lower half, so that the complete information on each change in status is visible without the
turning of the leaf.
Columns 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6-Same instructions are to be followed as for columns under the same headings on the quarterly roll, or completed
as indicated by headings.
Column 7-This column is intended to show all changes occurring as a result of men received, transferred, enlisted, reenlisted, discharged,
deserted, surrendered, or delivered, advanced in rating, reduced in rating, agreements to extend enlistment, extended enlistments that
become effective, retired, died, transferred to Fleet Reserve, turned over to civil authorities, also all courts-martial and deck courts, all special
or detached duty details including landing parties, or any other change that could possibly occur in the status of an enlisted man. As many
lines as there are changes should be used in preparing the roll. If a man is received one date, use a line to report his receipt; if his rating
is changed another date or the same date, use another line to report this change, etc.
Column 8-Date of occurrences in column 7. This column is provided to show the date that changes occur in the status of enlisted men
and must never be omitted.
Column 9-This column is intended to show all that is required by the heading, and in addition to the specific information required by the
heading, it is also to be used as a remark column and for any other purpose not herein mentioned that will enable the Bureau to know with
absolute accuracy the exact status of the enlisted man in question. As many lines as are necessary to show this information may be used. If
more than one line is used the corresponding lines at top of sheet must be left blank.
PASSENGER LISTS-LETTER FORM
Must be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing enlisted or enrolled men and other persons taking pas
sage on the vessel. Should passengers travel on other than a naval vessel, this report should be submitted by commandant of the naval district
from which vessel sails or the officer of the port.
RECAPITULATION SHEET
This form is to be submitted to the Bureau at the end of each quarter with the quarterly roll, and with final BNP 605b when ship, station,
aviation squadron, or unit is placed out of commission, or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent to decommissioning.
and is intended to furnish the Bureau with a summary of all changes which have occurred in the enlisted personnel on board ships and shore
stations during the period of which the quarterly roll or final BNP 605b is rendered. The number of changes shall be entered in column to
the right of sheet opposite the proper heading designated in the space to the left of sheet and must agree with the changes reported on
BNP 606b; i. e., if 10 honorable discharges have been issued during the quarter, the number "10" shall be entered in the number column on the
line designated "Honorable discharges, etc." The summary is intended to show whether a discrepancy exists between the muster roll and
report of changes. The number brought forward plus total gains for the quarter, minus total losses, should equal the number on the current
muster roll.
Note: See Articles D-4008 and D-4009, Bureau of Naval Personnel Manual, for further instructions.

INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING MUSTER ROLL
1. For additional instructions, see Articles D-4008 and D-4009, Bureau of Naval Personnel Manual, 1942.
2 NAVPERS 605a, Quarterly Roll, must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers, attached to ship, station, aviation
squadron, or unit, for permanent or temporary duty, for assignment, for medical treatment, or for instruction-with or without records-at
expiration of quarter; also all reservists on active duty-with or without pay.
3. NAVPERS 606b, Report of Changes. This form shall be submitted by the following:
(a) Commanding officers of all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units, whenever a ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit
is commissioned or decommissioned.
(b) Commanding officers of all naval vessels when sailing from one port to another, showing all changes in crew since submission
of last report. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
officers of aviation units, ship-based, whenever unit assumes a shore base status as a part of an organized
uadron, to show the transfer of men from parent vessel to squadron organization, and all other changes that may have occurred since
last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the unit.
(d) Commanding officers of aviation squadrons when the units return to their parent vessels for the purpose of assuming ship-
based
d status, to show transfer of men from squadron organization to the units ship-based, and all other changes that may have
occurred since last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the squadron.
(e) Commanding officers of all ships and stations on last day of each month, showing all changes for the month for which
submitted that have not been previously reported on these forms. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have
occurred
(f) Commanding officers of point or origin of transfer of enlisted passengers--men for transportation only-on date of sailing,
to show intended destination and name of transporting vessel.
(g) Commanding officers of naval vessels carrying enlisted passengers men for transportation only-on date of sailing headed
"Passengers" completed to show receipt and upon arriving at destination to show disposition. Any other changes that may have
occurred in the status of enlisted passengers en route.
(h) Commanding officers of point of destination at the end of the month following termination of passage on other than naval
vessels, completed to show receipt of enlisted passengers from point of origin, name of transporting vessel, and further disposition.
If any be removed by competent authority from a draft on other than a naval vessel prior to arriving at original destination, such
competent authority will be held responsible for informing the Bureau on these forms of the vessel from which removed, of the
circumstances of removal, and further disposition.
4. NAVPERS 605e, Passenger List. This form to be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing passengers
ether than enlisted personnel of the Navy taking passage on the vessel.
5. NAVPERS 6064, Recapitulation Sheet. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau with the quarterly roll and with final NAVPERS
605b, when ship, station, aviation squadron or unit is placed out of commission or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent
to decommissioning.
6. These instructions are to be followed by all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units. Reports must include all enlisted men and
all reservists on active duty with or without pay.
7. After the roll has been properly made out and certified to by the executive officer, signed by the commanding officer, it must be secured
between the binder boards provided for that purpose, placed in the special envelopes, and forwarded to the Bureau.
56:
DETAILED INSTRUCTIONS FOR PREPARING MUSTER ROLL
8. How written.-All sheets comprising the rolls shall be typewritten, except those submitted by stations and vessels not allowed type-
writers. Black record ribbon shall be used and all entries on a roll made with the same type machine and new ribbon. When hand written,
black ink shall be used and all entries on a roll made by the same person in clear, legible hand. The rolls must be free from erasures and inter-
lineations. No blank lines should be left between entries, except in cases where more than one line is used in column 9 on NAVPERS 605b,
Monthly Report of Changes, when the corresponding lines at top of sheet shall be left blank; only authorized abbreviations shall be used in
filling out the rolls.
FORWARDING SHEET (NAVPERS 605)
9. The several blank spaces on the first or forwarding sheet of the muster roll are to be correctly filled in the following manner and
forwarded to the Bureau of Naval Personnel with each quarterly roll:
(1) The name of the vessel or station submitting the roll.
(2) Date covering entries in muster roll.
(3) Number of pages comprising the roll must always be stated in this space. If the roll contains 35 pages, the number "1 to 35" must
appear.
(4) Number of pages NAVPERS 605b, Monthly Report of Changes, submitted during the quarter.
(5) Number of pages NAVPERS 605e, List of Passengers, which have been submitted during the quarter.
(6) NAVPERS 606d, Recapitulation Sheet.
This will enable the Bureau to know that all of the reports have been received for the quarter covered by the roll.
CERTIFICATE
10. The signature of the executive officer must always be attached to the certificate, and if this is omitted it will be necessary to return the
muster roll.
The commanding officer must approve the muster roll and affix his signature. The date of his approval does not have to agree with the
date covered by the roll.
In this space will be noted the date the roll was forwarded to the Bureau, and the location of the ship at time roll was forwarded.
It is not necessary to forward this sheet with NAVPERS 606b "Monthly Report of Changes" or with NAVPERS 605b and NAVPERS 605
"Passenger Lists" submitted at date of sailing, but one must always accompany each quarterly roll.
QUARTERLY ROLL (NAVPERS 605a)
11. The additional sheets for the quarterly roll are arranged to be used on both sides and are divided into columns. Each column is headed
with its number and the information it should show.
Column column is provided for the name of the enlisted man and must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers,
on board the ship or station at date roll is submitted. It is to be arranged strictly alphabetically, without regard to rating or branch of service.
The surname is to be placed to the left and the first name always written in full, and the initials of middle names, if any.
Column 2-This column is provided for the service number, and under circumstances will it be omitted.
Column 3-Rating at date of report.
Column 4-Date of enlistment. The date of enlistment as shown by this column must agree with the dates on the shipping article and
service record of the man, and it must always be the date of last enlistment.
Column 5-Date first received on board. It is intended that this column shall show the exact date each men on board was first received
in his present tour of duty. These dates will not be changed during a man's continuous service on the same ship or station. "Tour of duty"
and "Continuous service" mean the whole period from date first received to date permanently detached, and include (a) the time that may
be spent in hospitals or hospital ships for treatment or at service schools for instruction, temporary details in other vessels and at shore
stations, provided the men concerned return to the ships or stations from which sent on termination of hospitalization or training or temporary
details, (b) reenlistments on board, (c) when transferred for discharge and returned on reenlistment, (d) deserters from a command who may
surrender or be delivered thereto.
MONTHLY REPORT OF CHANGES (NAVPERS 605b)
12. The sheets are divided into two sections of 15 lines each. On the front of the sheet the lines are numbered from 1 to 15 and on the back
16 to 30, with the corresponding numbers on the lower half, so that the complete information on each change in status is visible without the
turning of the leaf.
Columns 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6-Same instructions are to be followed as for columns under the same headings on the quarterly roll, or completed
as indicated by headings.
Column 7-This column is intended to show all changes occurring as a result of men received (including temporary duty assignments),
transferred, enlisted, reenlisted, discharged, deserted, surrendered, or delivered, advanced in rating, reduced in rating, agreements to extend
enlistment, extended enlistments that become effective, retired, died, transferred to Fleet Reserve, turned over to civil authorities, also ail
courts-martial and deck courts, all special or detached duty details including landing parties, or any other change that could possibly occur
in the status of an enlisted man. As many lines as there are changes should be used in preparing the roll. If a man is received one date, use
a line to report his receipt; if his rating is changed another date or the same date, use another line to report this change, etc.
Column 8-Date of occurrences in column 7. This column is provided to show the date that changes occur in the status of enlisted men
and must never be omitted.
Column 9.-This column is intended to show all that is required by the heading, and in addition to the specific information required by the
heading, it is also to be used as a remark column and for any other purpose not herein mentioned that will enable the Bureau to know with
absolute accuracy the exact status of the enlisted man in question. As many lines as are necessary to show this information may be used. If
more than one line is used the corresponding lines at top of sheet must be left blank.
PASSENGER LISTS-LETTER FORM
13. Must be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing enlisted or enrolled men and other persons taking
passage on the vessel. Should passengers travel on other than a naval vessel, this report should be submitted by commandant of the naval
district from which vessel sails or the officer of the port.
RECAPITULATION SHEET (NAVPERS 605d)
14. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau at the end of each quarter with the quarterly roll, and with final NAVPERS 605b when ship,
station, aviation squadron, or unit is placed out of commission, or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent to decommis-
sioning, and is intended to furnish the Bureau with a summary of all changes which have occurred in the enlisted personnel on board ships and
shore stations during the period of which the quarterly roll or final NAVPERS 6056 is rendered. The number of changes shall be entered in
column to the right of sheet opposite the proper heading designated in the space to the left of sheet and must agree with the changes reported
on NAVPERS 605b; i. e., if 10 honorable discharges have been issued during the quarter, the number "10" shall be entered in the number
column on the line designated "Honorable discharges, etc." The summary is intended to show whether a discrepancy exists between the
muster roll and report of changes. The number brought forward plus total gains for the quarter, minus total losses, should equal the number
on the current muster roll.

INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING MUSTER ROLL
1. For additional instructions, see Articles D-4008 and D-4009, Bureau of Naval Personnel Manual, 1942.
2. NAVPERS 605a, Quarterly Roll, must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers, attached to ship, station, aviation
squadron, or unit, for permanent or temporary duty, for assignment, for medical treatment, or for instruction-with or without records at
expiration of quarter; also all reservists on active duty-with or without pay.
3. NAVPERS 606b, Report of Changes. This form shall be submitted by the following:
(a) Commanding officers of all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units, whenever a ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit
is commissioned or decommissioned.
(b) Commanding officers of all naval vessels when sailing from one port to another, showing all changes in crew since submission
of last report. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
(e) Commanding officers of pviation units, ship-based, whenever unit assumes a shore base status as a part of an organized
aquadron, to show the transfer of men from parent vessel to squadron organization, and all other changes that may have occurred since
last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the unit.
(d) Commanding officers of aviation squadrons when the units return to their parent vessels for the purpose of assuming ship-
based status, to show transfer of men from squadron organization to the units ship-based, and all other changes that may have
occurred since last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the squadron.
(e) Commanding officers of all ships and stations on last day of each month, showing all changes for the month for which
submitted that have not been previously reported on these forms. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have
occurred
(f) Commanding officers of point or origin of transfer of enlisted passengers-men for transportation only-on date of sailing,
to show intended destination and name of transporting vessel.
(g) Commanding officers of naval vessels carrying enlisted passengers-men for transportation only on date of sailing headed
"Passengers" completed to show receipt and upon arriving at destination to show disposition. Any other changes that may have
occurred in the status of enlisted p
passengers en route.
(h) Commanding officers of point of destination at the end of the month following termination of passage on other than naval
vessels, completed to show receipt of enlisted passengers from point of origin, name of transporting vessel, and further disposition.
If any be removed by competent authority from a draft on other than a naval vessel prior to arriving at original destination, such
competent authority will be held responsible for informing the Bureau on these forms of the vessel from which removed, of the
circumstances of removal, and further disposition.
4. NAVPERS 605c, Passenger List. This form to be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing passengers
other than enlisted personnel of the Navy taking parsage on the vessel.
& NAVPERS 605d, Recapitulation Sheet. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau with the quarterly roll and with final NAVPERS
605b, when ship, station, aviation squadron or unit is placed out of commission or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent
to decommissioning.
6. These instructions are to be followed by all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units. Reports must include all enlisted men and
all reservists on active duty with or without pay.
7. After the roll has been properly made out and certified to by the executive officer, signed by the commanding officer, it must be secured
between the binder boards provided for that purpose, placed in the special envelopes, and forwarded to the Bureau.

INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING MUSTER ROLL
BNP 605a, Quarterly Roll, must show the name of every enlisted man attached to ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit at expiration of
quarter; also all reservista on active duty-with or without pay.
BNP 606b, Report of Changes. This form shall be submitted by the following:
Commanding officers of all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units, whenever a ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit is
commissioned or decommissioned
Commanding officers of all naval vessels when sailing from one port to another, showing all changes in crew since submission
of last report. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
Commanding officers of aviation units, ship-based, whenever unit assumes a shore base status as a part of an organized squad-
ron, to show the transfer of men from parent vessel to squadron organization, and all other changes that may have occurred since
last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the unit.
Commanding officers of aviation squadrons when the units return to their parent vessels for the purpose of assuming ship-based
status, to show transfer of men from squadron organization to the units ship-based, and all other changes that may have occurred
since last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the squadron.
Commanding officers of all ships and stations on last day of each month, showing all changes for the month for which submitted
that have not been previously reported on these forms. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
Commanding officers of point or origin of transfer of enlisted passengers-men for transportation only on date of sailing, to
show intended destination and name of transporting vessel.
Commanding officers of naval vessels carrying enlisted passengers-men for transportation only-on date of sailing headed
"Passengers" completed to show receipt and upon arriving at destination to show disposition. Any other changes that may have
occurred in the status of enlisted passengers en route.
Commanding officers of point of destination at the end of the month following termination of passage on other than naval
vessels, completed to show receipt of enlisted passengers from point of origin, name of transporting vessel, and further disposition.
If any be removed by competent authority from a draft on other than a naval vessel prior to arriving at original destination, such
competent authority will be held responsible for informing the Bureau on these forms of the vessel from which removed, of the
circumstances of removal, and further disposition.
BNP 605e, Passenger List. This form to be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing passengers other
than enlisted personnel of the Navy taking passage on the vessel.
BNP 605d, Recapitulation Sheet. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau with the quarterly roll and with final BNP 605b, when
ship, station, aviation squadron or unit is placed out of commission or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent to
decommissioning.
These instructions are to be followed by all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units. Reports must include all enlisted men and
all reservists on active duty with or without pay.
After the roll has been properly made out and certified to by the executive officer, signed by the commanding officer, it must be secured
between the binder boards provided for that purpose, placed in the special envelopes, and forwarded to the Bureau.

INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING MUSTER ROLL
Executive Officer.
Commanding Officer.
1. For additional instructions, see Articles D-4008 and D-4009, Bureau of Naval Personnel Manual, 1942.
2. NAVPERS 605a, Quarterly Roll, must show the name of every enlisted man, except passengers, attached to ship, station, aviation
squadron, or unit, for permanent or temporary duty, for assignment, for medical treatment, or for instruction-with or without records-at
expiration of quarter; also all reservists on active duty-with or without pay.
3. NAVPERS 606b, Report of Changes. This form shall be submitted by the following:
(a) Commanding officers of all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units, whenever a ship, station, aviation squadron, or unit
is commissioned or decommissioned.
(b) Commanding officers of all naval vessels when sailing from one port to another, showing all changes in crew since submission
of last report. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have occurred.
(e) Commanding officers of aviation units, ship-based, whenever unit assumes a shore base status as a part of an organized
squadron, to show the transfer of men from parent vessel to squadron organization, and all other changes that may have occurred since
last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the unit.
(d) c Commanding officers of aviation i squadrons when the units return to their parent vessels for the purpose of assuming ship-
based
d status, to show transfer of men from squadron organization to the units ship-based, and all other changes that may have
occurred since last report. Equivalent to decommissioning the squadron.
(e) Commanding officers of all ships and stations on last day of each month, showing all changes for the month for which
submitted that have not been previously reported on these forms. These forms to be submitted whether or not any changes have
occurred.
(f) Commanding officers of point or origin of transfer of enlisted passengers-men for transportation only-on date of sailing.
to show intended destination and name of transporting vessel.
(g) Commanding officers of naval vessels carrying enlisted passengers men for transportation only on date of sailing headed
"Passengers" completed to show receipt and upon arriving at destination to show disposition. Any other changes that may have
occurred in the status of enlisted passengers en t route.,
(h) Commanding officers of point of destination at the end of the month following termination of passage on other than naval
vessels, completed to show receipt of enlisted passengers from point of origin, name of transporting vessel, and further disposition.
If any be removed by competent authority from a draft on other than a naval vessel prior to arriving at original destination, such
competent authority will be held responsible for informing the Bureau on these forms of the vessel from which removed, of the
circumstances of removal, and further disposition.
4. NAVPERS 605e, Passenger List. This form to be submitted by vessel at date of sailing from one port to another, showing passengers
ether than enlisted personnel of the Navy taking passage on the vessel.
& NAVPERS 606d, Recapitulation Sheet. This form is to be submitted to the Bureau with the quarterly roll and with final NAVPERS
605b, when ship, station, aviation squadron or unit is placed out of commission or when aviation squadron and units assume a status equivalent
to decommissioning.
6. These instructions are to be followed by all ships, stations, aviation squadrons, and units. Reports must include all enlisted men and
all reservists on active duty with or without pay.
7. After the roll has been properly made out and certified to by the executive officer, signed by the commanding officer, it must be secured
between the binder boards provided for that purpose, placed in the special envelopes, and forwarded to the Bureau.
